metadata.title: CVE-2021-47253 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/amd/display: Fix potential memory leak in DMUB hw_init[Why]On resume we perform DMUB hw_init which allocates memory:dm_resume->dm_dmub_hw_init->dc_dmub_srv_create->kzallocThat results in memory leak in suspend/resume scenarios.[How]Allocate memory for the DC wrapper to DMUB only if it was notallocated before.No need to reallocate it on suspend/resume.
